section.title: Platform Notes
section.para: In this section, the word "flavor" refers to a combination of compiler type (gcc or other), 32 or 64 bit libraries, and debugging enabled or not.

section.title: Apple MacOS X
section.para: Binaries not available due to GPT bug 258.

section.title: Debian
section.para: Some kernel/libc combinations trigger a threading problem. See bug #2194. The workaround is to set LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.2.5 in your environment.

section.title: Fedora Core
section.para: Fedora Core 2 and later ship with a broken ant. Install your own ant from http://ant.apache.org and either remove the ant RPM or edit /etc/ant.conf, setting ANT_HOME to your own ant installation.

section.title: HP/UX
section.para: Specify --with-flavor=vendorcc32 on the configure line. GNU tar, GNU sed, and GNU make are required on the PATH.
Tested on a PA-RISC box with HPUX 11.11 with IPv6 patches.
For HP-UX on IA64, see the patches in bug 3234

section.title: IBM AIX
section.para: Supported flavors are vendorcc32dbg/vendorcc32 and vendorcc64dbg/vendorcc64 using the Visual Age compilers (xlc). No gcc flavors are supported. Specify a flavor using --with-flavor=flavor.
GNU sed, tar, and make are required before the IBM ones in the PATH.

section.title: Sun Solaris
section.para: Supported flavors are gcc32, gcc64, vendorcc32 and vendorcc64. The dbg flavors should work as well. For gcc64, a gcc built to target 64 bit object files is required. The gcc32dbg flavor will be used by default. Specify other flavors using --with-flavor=flavor.
GPT has problems with the Sun provided perl and tar: http://www.gridpackagingtools.org/book/latest-stable/ch01s07.html

section.para:
Only Java-only components will build. Please choose the Java WS Core-only download and follow the instructions in the
